author: Staff Reporter
text:
Senior CPI leader D. Pandian has urged the State government to hold talks with the protesting government employees and find a solution.

Addressing reporters here on Thursday, he said that the indefinite strike by the employees is affecting the common public and the government should come forward and invite the associations for talks. He also wanted the State government to give priority to the welfare of the differently-abled persons who were protesting for many days now. “The government should consider their demands with humanity”, he added.
title: D. Pandian urges govt. to hold talks with protesters
